meanings.sent1: The crinkled paper was difficult to fold neatly.
meanings.sent2: She wore a crinkled shirt to the casual party.
meanings.sent3: The crinkled map led them on a twisted adventure.
meanings.sent4: His crinkled smile showed years of laughter.
meanings.sent5: The crinkled leaves rustled in the autumn breeze.

meanings.sent1: She crinkled her nose in distaste at the smell.
meanings.sent2: The old book crinkled as he turned the pages.
meanings.sent3: The cat crinkled up its body to fit in the small box.
meanings.sent4: His forehead crinkled in confusion as he tried to understand.
meanings.sent5: The paper crinkled under the weight of the heavy books.

meanings.definition: Having a wrinkled or creased appearance
meanings.sent1: The crinkled fabric of the curtains gave the room a cozy feel.
meanings.sent2: Her crinkled skirt looked stylish with the vintage theme.
meanings.sent3: The crinkled bedsheet made it seem like a messy morning.
meanings.sent4: The crinkled road map hinted at past travels and adventures.
meanings.sent5: The crinkled petals of the flower added charm to the garden.
